Fields.DialogueText: Hello, Kapitän! How are you doing?
I'm well. Leberecht Maass, right?
That's what they call me! But Leberecht is fine, really.
I haven't seen you much around the ship. Why is that?
Most people tend to ignore me.
I'm sorry to hear that. Do you want me to have a word with the crew?
Schon gut. I completely understand why they do it.

Fields.MenuText: ... Do I want to know?
What do you mean? Why?
I'm sure you're a great girl! I don't know what you're talking about.

Fields.DialogueText: Wahrscheinlich nicht? I don't know why you would.
It's not a big deal! Don't worry yourself over it.
Rest assured, you'll see soon enough.
Uh... anyway, it seems that some Morganas have just been spotted. We'd better be on our way.
Ja, Kapitän!
@BATTLE
That was a tougher battle than I'd anticipated.
I'd be wary of Leberecht, Captain. They say that her bad luck can be passed to anyone.
... Really?
Kapitän! I have a question for you!
Does this have something to do with those midshipmen who just ran by?
Oh, nein. They're just avoiding me.
... Okay. This is getting ridiculous.
How so?
You're not bad luck. And I'm not going to have you shunned for no good reason.
Nein, nein, I'm completely bad luck! One hundred percent jinxed!
Haven't the sailors told you any stories yet?
Not... more than sixteen or twenty. Today.
Das dachte ich mir schon. Maybe I should go find the first mate - you should be protected.

Fields.MenuText: I'm really sorry you feel that way.
Yes. It is. I don't believe in luck, anyway.
Stop. It's just because they don't know you that well. It only takes ten seconds of talking to you to tell that you're perfectly fine.

Fields.DialogueText: It's fine, honestly. It barely even bothers me anymore!
I don't mean to be difficult, but... I'm fully aware I'm not the most fortunate of individuals.
My intentions always are, at the very least!
Leberecht, I...
*ALARM*
Ah, nuts. Get ready for battle, everyone!
@BATTLE
None of your bad luck has rubbed off on me yet!
Probably the longest I've gone without that happening in... well, ever!
She's certainly a... curious sort of person.
Please don't. The way some crew members treat you is ridiculous - and I mean to fix it, not join in.
It's not ridiculous at all, though!
Leberecht! I've had words with some of our more superstitious crew members. You can expect written apologies for their disrespect.
What are you talking about?
The running away. The throwing salt over their shoulders after you pass by. That's kind of thing.
Es hat mich nicht gestört. I had already forgotten about it!

Fields.MenuText: You're too kind for your own good.
Even so, it shouldn't happen again.
Well, *I'm* not going to forget.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't really think I'd be better off feeling angry.
Oh. Well... okay. Danke.
Bitte regen Sie sich nicht auf. This is just trivial.
Are you really even that unlucky? I've just heard rumors.
The rumors are true. In fact, the sooner you leave, the safer you'll be.
Surely it can't be that bad.
Oh doch. Let me assure you - it can.
*ALARM*
Well... it looks like more Morganas are headed this direction. Get to your stations, everyone!
@BATTLE
Leberecht! Do you have time to talk for a second?
Jawohl! All the time in the world.
I've noticed something recently. You take a lot of walks on the deck by yourself. Why is that?
Well, that, Kapitän, is because I have no friends! I know that makes me seem rather pathetic, but it's the truth of the matter.

Fields.MenuText: Y-you really don't have any friends? I'm so sorry...
Are you surprised? It's probably all the bad luck! Nobody wants to be around that.
Leberecht, do you joke to cover up the pain?

Fields.DialogueText: Nicht Einen! Honestly, I'm surprised they didn't scuttle me years ago!
Uh, sure, Kapitän. You're not wrong!
What? Nein, I have no pain - why would you think I have pain? That's a ridiculous statement, utterly ridiculous. Put it out of your head, Kapitän.
You're a very... odd girl.
That's probably another reason I don't have friends!
*ALARM*
*sigh* There's the alarm. Let's go.
@BATTLE
Hallo, Kapitän! I received your message to meet you here. What did you need to talk about?
Well, Leberecht... I'm afraid I have some bad news...
Did someone die? Is the ship sinking? Is it my fault? What did I do?
Whoa, slow down! It's nothing like that. It's just, I thought it'd be best if you didn't fire your small arms in battle anymore.
... What do you mean?
A few crew members have come to me with complaints of your poor shot. It's bad for morale and dangerous during battle.
Please don't do this, Kapitän. I'm working to improve my aim! I'll show you, I promise.

Fields.MenuText: Do you think you can improve? If you do, I might allow you to continue.
Leberecht, I'm talking about your personal weapons, not the naval guns. They're mostly symbolic anyway, right?
I think it might be best if you give up that dream. We can't afford mistakes during battle.

Fields.DialogueText: Ich kann! Definitely! Let me show you! I'll put in so much hard work and effort, it'll be like I'm a changed woman!
And the symbolism is important!
Nein, nothing you say can make me give up.
Why don't you watch me shoot? I see some Nixen approaching now. Come on, let's go! I need to keep trying, don't I?
Leberecht, no!
@BATTLE
This girl is going to make my life hell...
Okay, Leberecht. Why don't we find a job for you on board the ship? Perhaps you could learn some skills that would help you in battle.
Wunderbar! Sounds perfect! What would you like me to do?
Well...

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you could be a lookout! It could improve your observation skills.
Would you like to be a cleaning lady? It might improve your mobility.
How about you help the people down in the engine room? You need flexibility to maneuver around all those parts.

Fields.DialogueText: That won't do. I'm as blind as a bat!
I've never really been allowed to clean things. I tend to make things dirtier.
I don't think that's a good idea, Kapitän. I'm not good with machinery. I always seem to break things.
Is there anything you're good at?
Well, there's... um... nein. Not particularly.
Uh... well then... in that case... if you think of some way you can help out on board... go for it?
Will do, Kapitän!
*ALARM*
Okay, we have more Morganas headed this way. What are you going to do?
Do my best to only aim at enemy ships!
@BATTLE
Hello, Leberecht! Leberecht? What are you looking at?
Was? Oh, sorry! Nothing! I wasn't looking at anything. I was just kind of... daydreaming.

Fields.MenuText: Leberecht! This is a busy ship! You shouldn't have time to just sit around like this! Find something to do.
I'm sorry that we don't have anything on this ship that fits your... skill set.
I hope you don't blame me for your boredom. You know I tried, right? You're just not, how do I put this...

Fields.DialogueText: Jawohl. I'll do my best.
That's the funniest thing you've ever said, Kapitän! What's in my skill set? Nothing?
Especially good at anything? Ja, ich weiß.
Leberecht, I know! I have a massive number of books in my office which need arranging. Do you think you could do it by... color? It's a very important job.
Natürlich! I can do that! What color order would you like them in?
Rainbow order. Red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo and violet.
I'll get started right away! Thank you, Kapitän!
All right! Have fun, Leberecht!
*ALARM*
Wait a minute! Come back! The Morganas are back!
@BATTLE
Kapitän, I need to talk to you right now!
Please don't trip over anything. And I'm busy right now. Can't we do this later?
Nein, durchaus nicht! We're doing this now!
... Fine, Leberecht. What's bothering you?
I am so angry with you! I can't believe you would do something like that to me!
Slow down! What are you talking about?
I overheard the officers saying you had given me a dud of a job. You lied to me! You told me arranging those books was important!

Fields.MenuText: Who said that? They're going to receive a stern talking to.
I'm sorry I did that, Leberecht. I was just trying to make you feel better.
Don't get mad at me! I was trying to help you! I don't deserve to sit here while you yell at me!

Fields.DialogueText: It doesn't matter. All that matters is that you lied to me! And you don't even feel bad about it!
You thought the best way to make me feel better would be by lying to me? Great plan!
Yes, you do! You lied to me!
I am your captain! What gives you the right to talk to me like this?
I can't respect a liar.
Is that a fact?
Uh... Captain? Some Morganas have been spotted. We need you on deck.
At least I can take my anger out on them...
@BATTLE
Leberecht! Please stop! I need to talk to you!
Ja? What is it?
I wanted to apologize for lying to you - and I want to make amends.
Fine. I can't hold grudges anyway. I'm sorry I was so mad.
It's okay. Forgive and forget, right?
Gerne! That's a relief!

Fields.MenuText: Great! And, might I add, you're looking particularly beautiful today!
I'm glad you think so. You are truly a magnificent woman.
You're quite a smart girl!

Fields.DialogueText: You don't mean that.
Oh, good grief, stop, Kapitän.
Please don't say that.
It's true, though!
So now you're trying flattery? I can't believe you...
What? Are you mad at me again?
Natürlich! Flattery is a lie, too.
*ALARM*
Leberecht, can you put this aside for just a second?
Na gut...
@BATTLE
Kapitän? Are you there?
I'm here, but I'm pretty busy at the moment.
Okay. I just wanted to stop by and bring you this cake. Ich hoffe er ist essbar. It's kind of burnt in some spots and undercooked in others...
... and I didn't have enough icing for the entire thing... but I hope you like it.
Why are you bringing me a cake?
I feel bad. I've gotten mad at you twice now. You're my Kapitän. I shouldn't be disrespecting you. Es tut mir leid.

Fields.MenuText: ... I forgive you. Everyone's been under a lot of stress lately and tensions have been high. I understand. I'm sorry for acting like a jerk too. Thank you for the cake.
Leberecht, I can't overlook the disrespect you showed me so easily. I need you to leave, and take the cake with you.
I don't want your cake. Just looking at it makes me nauseous...

Fields.DialogueText: I appreciate you saying that. So, you're sure everything's okay? I just need to be positive about this because it's been weighing on my conscious so heavily and...
I understand where you're coming from, but can you please reconsider? I feel so guilty about all of this. I won't do it again. Please, Kapitän?
Yeah, it kind of makes me nauseous too. I'm sorry the cake is such a disappointment, just like everything else I do.
... Leberecht, I forgive you. I'm actually busy, though, so I do need some privacy.
Ja - natürlich! Sorry. I guess I could try and make you another cake if you want.
No, thank you, it's fine. Do me a favor, though. Are those Morganas out there?
Well, I can't see them, but I do think I can hear them.
I guess we'd better get to the bridge, then.
@BATTLE
Kapitän! I tried to make another cake!
Oh, dear God, no... uh, what kind is it?
All vanilla!
Then, uh, why is it brown?
Probably because it's burnt. But it's not undercooked this time, and I had enough frosting!
You certainly did. That is a good deal of frosting right there...
Do you like it?

Fields.MenuText: I certainly appreciate the time and effort you put into making this for me.
It looks delicious! I'm excited to eat it!
No, I really don't. Leberecht, it just looks disgusting.

Fields.DialogueText: How do you feel about the cake, though? Oh, wait, I see. I know it's not very good. I'm a mess in the kitchen!
Y-you're just trying to spare my feelings. I know, I know. It's a pretty terrible cake. You can tell me.
You've never been more right, Kapitän! Whoever made this cake should be thrown in the brig!
*ALARM*
There are the alarms. Leberecht, get ready for battle!
@BATTLE
Oh no! The cake went overboard in the battle. What a shame!
I could make a new one!
No, no! That's quite all right!
¡Hola, Capitán! ¿Cómo estás?
Leberecht! I wasn't aware you could speak Spanish.
¡Sí, Capitán! Just a little, conversationally! Aren't you impressed?

Fields.MenuText: ¡Sí! ¿Le gustaría tener una conversación?
I mean... Belles just generally know a number of languages, right?
Wow! Do you think you could teach me a little bit?

Fields.DialogueText: Um... what?
Una grande cerveza, por favor.
Oh,  I don't know that much Spanish...
We don't currently have any Spanish-speakers serving on board, right? When did you have a chance to learn?
I went vacationing in Spain one time and picked up a little bit then. I'm trying to learn a little bit more because I really want to go back one day!
Maybe you will. You seem like an experienced traveler. Hey! Maybe that's what you're good at!
You don't have to have talent to be taken to different places. Thanks for trying, though! So dumm...
Did you just call me...?
*ALARM*
There are more important matters at hand! The Nixen are back!
@BATTLE
Leberecht, are you okay?
Ja, why wouldn't I be?
I just saw the first mate yelling at you. What was that all about?
I was practicing shooting and I, uh... just barely missed her head.
Oh, my God...
Um... Hoppla? Oops?

Fields.MenuText: Almost killing someone is not an 'oops!' It makes sense that she was yelling at you!
You have to be more careful. This is starting to get out of hand.
I'm this close to revoking your gun privileges.

Fields.DialogueText: Es tut mir Leid! I'm sorry! I really am trying.
It's not like I meant to do it. It was an accident!
Please, please, please don't! I still need to practice! How am I going to get any better if I don't have a gun?
Leberecht, I can't believe you sometimes.
*ALARM*
It's the Nixen again! That means more practice for me!
No friendly fire!
@BATTLE
Back to doing nothing again, Leberecht?
For now. I'm sorry I haven't found my niche yet, Kapitän.
*sigh* I'm sorry too, Leberecht. I know you really have been trying to help.
I appreciate you acknowledging as much. And don't worry, I'm brainstorming new ideas as we speak.
... Leberecht?
Ja, Kapitän?
How do you keep doing this day after day? You encounter failure after failure, but you never stop trying. Your ability to pick yourself back up... It's amazing.
I just know that I can't give up. If I do, my whole life will spiral downwards. If I keep trying, I have hope that something will come from it one day.

Fields.MenuText: Isn't that ridiculous, though? How long has it been? Nothing's gotten better.
That's admirable. I wish everyone on this ship had your drive.
I respect that. If I were you, I would've given up by now.

Fields.DialogueText: At least I try. That's all that matters.
I'm obviously the role model here!
Maybe I am better than you at something, then!
We'll have to delay this conversation for another time. It looks like we have some Morganas to fight!
@BATTLE
Leberecht? I wanted to ask you something...
Ja? What is it?
Well, I trust that you'll be completely honest with me, so... does this shirt look good on me?
Nein.

Fields.MenuText: What?! That was so blunt! I thought it looked at least decent...
Well, you know what? I like this shirt, so I'm going to keep wearing it!
All right, I respect your opinion. Thank you for your honesty.

Fields.DialogueText: You're the one who asked.
Okay. I just gave you my opinion, you can do whatever you want. I don't make your decisions for you.
You're welcome! I'll always tell you the truth, Kapitän.
So can you tell me honestly if you're up to fighting those Morganas on the horizon?
Ja! I always am!
Okay, if you're sure.
@BATTLE
Kapitän, Kapitän!
What is it?! What's wrong? Are you hurt?
Nein, I just have something important to tell you!
Hold that thought. There are some incoming Morganas that need taking care of first!
@BATTLE
Please don't tell me that the engine room is on fire...
Nein, nein, nein. Nicht doch. I was just talking to one of the lookouts and they told me that they have a Zwergspitz back home!

Fields.MenuText: What does that have to do with anything?
That's all you have to say?!
That's adorable! But not necessarily important...

Fields.DialogueText: I love Zwergspitze!
Well, ja! Zwergspitze are wonderful creatures. I was really excited.
Zwergspitze are important to me...
I want one!
Then why don't you get one?
I'll spread my bad luck to it.
... What? You can buy yourself a Zwergspitz. I really don't think your luck will affect it...
... I have to go now.
What? Why?
I have work to do.
A Zwerg- you mean the dog breed?
Ja!
Hello, Leberecht! How are you doing?
Just... just imagine if all this ocean were grass, and there were wildflowers and farms and trees.
That would be a lot of grass.
Genau das ist es! That's what I'm trying to say! I wish I could run around in a field somewhere.

Fields.MenuText: Just you saying that makes me long for it. I've never been a fan of cities.
That's ridiculous! Wouldn't you much rather walk around a city for a couple hours?
Ah, my heart belongs to the ocean. I wish I never had to go back to land.

Fields.DialogueText: We should bring the ship to shore right now!  If only. I miss picking flowers...
Durchaus nicht! Cities are dirty and gross and loud. I would rather walk the plank than walk in a city!
I'm a little... scared of the ocean.
My opinion isn't important, though. It's obvious that we're going to be on the ocean for a long, long time.
*ALARM*
And that means having to deal with things like the Morganas. Everyone, get to your battle stations!
@BATTLE
Kaaaaaaaapitän! I have a surprise for you!
I'm excited! What is it?
I've been getting some of the sailors to help me out with this for a while since I'm not good at fishing...
Fishing? What kind of fish do you have for me?
Pickled herring! Bismarckhering, to be precise!

Fields.MenuText: Oh... thanks.
That sounds delicious! Thank you very much!
Do you actually like that stuff?! It smells gross...

Fields.DialogueText: You don't sound that excited about it...
You're quite welcome! It's so delicious, isn't it?
You - you smell gross! ... Sorry I said that, but I'm offended that you're insulting one of my favorite foods!
Here, come on. I'll take it. So you really like this stuff?
Well, it's not my absolute favorite. It's one of them, though. My real favorite is Errötende Jungfrau!
Sorry. I didn't quite hear...
Errötende Jungfrau! It's a buttermilk and lingonberry dessert.
I'll need to keep that in mind for your birthday.
You'd... you'd do that for me?
*ALARM*
Better get to your station, Leberecht.
Jawohl! Of course!
@BATTLE
Kapitän?
Gah!
Leberecht! You startled me. Do you... do you need something?
Yes, actually. What... what do you fear the most?
That's an odd question...
Ich weiss. Can you answer it anyway?

Fields.MenuText: Sure... I guess I'm most afraid of heights.
Sure... my biggest fear is speaking in front of people.
Sure... I'm still a little afraid of the dark.

Fields.DialogueText: Interesting...
I guess that makes sense, but don't you have to do a lot of that as Kapitän?
I understand where you're coming from. Who knows what's hiding in there?
What's your greatest fear, Leberecht?
Das Meer. The sea.
That doesn't make any sense. You're a ship!
I never said it made any sense. I just... felt the need to tell you that, but forget it. I'm sorry, we don't have to talk about this anymore.
*ALARM*
There are Nixen headed this way, anyway!
You're right. Get everyone on deck and prepare for battle!
@BATTLE
Leberecht! Can you come here for a second? I can't stop thinking about what you told me...
What did I tell you?
About you being scared of the water. It just doesn't make sense.
I guess it's not a fear, per se. It's just a lingering anxiety. I'm not a good sailor and when the waters get rough, I worry about what could happen.

Fields.MenuText: I'm surprised you haven't overcome it by now.
This must be hell for you, then. Is there anything I can do to help?
You should probably get over that. The war won't end anytime soon.

Fields.DialogueText: You'd think I would have, but I guess fear just doesn't work that way. It's been pretty constant for years.
Ich glaube nicht. I wish there was, but I doubt that this will ever go away.
That's not how fear works, though. It's not something that will just go away.
Then I hope we won't encounter any large storms anytime soon.
I hope so too. Luckily, the only dangers we're facing right now are those Nixen on the horizon. I guess we'd better take care of them.
@BATTLE
Storm on the horizon!
Nein. Nein, nein...
Leberecht, calm down. We just need to go below deck and everything will be fine.
Nein, nein, nein! I'm not a good enough ship. I'm going to capsize! We're all going to drown! I can't do this!

Fields.MenuText: I believe in you, Leberecht. You can do this. We'll get through it together.
How can I help if you won't listen to me?!
I have a crew to take care of. Please just go below deck!

Fields.DialogueText: Na gut, we can make it. I'll go below deck.
Es tut mir leid. I'm sorry, I'm sorry. I'll listen, I promise. I'll go below deck.
Okay, sorry for bothering you. I'll go below deck.
*ALARM*
Wait, Leberecht! The Morganas are back! I need you here for right now! Get ready to fight, everyone!
... She's going to love this.
@BATTLE
Okay, Leberecht. Let's go below deck now. You're okay. Let's get you to a safe place.
You're sure everything's going to be all right?
Yes. Don't worry. I've got you.
Kapitän? I think I owe you an apology.
An apology for what? ... Hold that thought, Leberecht. There are some Morganas on the horizon, and I'm afraid they're sailing towards us.
@BATTLE
So what was it you wanted to apologize for?
For getting so nervous during that storm. I truly am a disappointment to you and the crew.

Fields.MenuText: Leberecht, it's okay. You're not a disappointment. There are things that scare us all. We can't help our fears.
I won't lie, I am a little disappointed. If the other captains knew I had a Belle with a fear of the water, they wouldn't stop laughing.
We can work on your fear together! There's nothing that can't be fixed.

Fields.DialogueText: I should be able to, though. It's not like the ocean is anything new to me.
That's what they call me, you know? Laughing-stock Leberecht!
I'm not sure about that, Kapitän. It's been so, so long. I don't think there's anything I can do about it at this point.
Everything will be fine, Leberecht. Forget about it, okay? You just need to move on.
... Ja. Gut! I know you're right. I know my fears are unfounded. Mostly. I just need to face them. Thanks for the encouragement, Kapitän.
Of course, Leberecht.
Kapitän, Kapitän!
Kapitäaaaan!
Guess what, guess what!

Fields.MenuText: You finally learned how to shoot a gun?
You conquered your fear of the ocean?
You baked a proper cake?

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! Nein, not yet.
Uh... ha. I'm working on that!
I've never been good at baking, so, no.
Then, what is it?
I caught a herring! I decided to try fishing by myself, and I did it!
Congratulations!
Maybe I am good at something!
Well, that's a pretty tiny fish...
Shhh! It's still something. I'm proud of what I accomplished.
As you should be. But you're going to have to put your fish down, for now. We have Morganas headed this way.
Jawohl!
@BATTLE
Leberecht? What's wrong? You seem-
Oh nein, where did my herring go?
... I'll leave you to it.
Leberecht! Can you come here for a second?
What is it, Kapitän?
I have something for you.
A present?! I can't believe it - you're so kind!
You don't even know what it is yet.
But I never get presents! I don't care what it is - I'm thrilled!
Well, I think you'll be especially thrilled with this - It's Errötende Jungfrau!
Ach du meine Güte! Thank you so much! It looks amazing! How did you get this?
It wasn't particularly dramatic. I asked the cook if he could show me how to make it and he said yes.
You made it? Can you teach me how? My attempts never seem to come out right.

Fields.MenuText: I don't know... the cook might not want me to give away her secret recipe.
Of course! I'd be happy to show you some time.
Are you sure you wouldn't rather the cook teach you? I think she'd make a much better teacher than I would.

Fields.DialogueText: You can't just do that to me! That's not fair!
Das ist fantastisch!
Nonsense. I always learn best from you, Kapitän.
I want to hear all about your cooking experience.
And I'll tell you all about it... later. I see some Morganas approaching.
@BATTLE
Kapitän! That Errötende Jungfrau was so good! Vielen Dank!
Well, I was happy to make it for you.
Do you think you could show me how to make it now?
*ALARM*
Maybe later. We have company.
@BATTLE
Now that we've defeated those Nixen, I'm ready for my baking lesson.
Before we do that, Leberecht, there's something important I've been meaning to tell you...
What's that?

Fields.MenuText: I really do consider you to be a friend, you know. I'll always be here for you.
Just that, in spite of all the trouble you cause, I've grown to really... well, I'm really happy to have you by my side, Leberecht.

Fields.DialogueText: Kapitän... that means a lot to me. I thought that, maybe, we were friends, but I didn't want to say anything and curse the friendship.
That's... that's so sweet of you, Kapitän. I'm happy to have you by my side as well.
Now, why don't we get started on that baking lesson?
Ja! Let's do it!
Now, why don't we get started on that baking lesson?
Ja! Let's do it!
Heh, that doesn't surprise me.
